meanings.definition: Present participle of pony: to lead or guide a pony.
meanings.sent1: She was ponying the pony along the trail.
meanings.sent2: The children enjoy ponying around the farm.
meanings.sent3: He tried ponying the pony with a carrot, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: She was ponying the pony through the obstacles like a skilled trainer.
meanings.sent5: The image of her ponying the pony under the bright sun stayed with him.

meanings.definition: Plural noun: small horses of a particular breed.
meanings.sent1: The ponies in the field were grazing peacefully.
meanings.sent2: She loved riding the ponies at the petting zoo.
meanings.sent3: The ponies' playful antics always brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: The herd of ponies resembled a colorful painting on the green meadow.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the ponies' hooves on the ground was music to her ears.
